units.title: Cortical organoid differentiation from iPS cells
units.text: Cortical organoids were cultured using a forebrain-directed differentiation protocol47,58. In brief, two genetically normal human iPS cell lines (H28126 (Gilad Laboratory, University of Chicago) and 1323-4 (Conklin Laboratory, Gladstone Institutes)), which were previously authenticated47, and the embryonic stem cell line H1 (WiCell, authenticated at source), were expanded and dissociated into single cells using accutase. Cells tested negative for mycoplasma. After dissociation, cells were pelleted at 600g in a swinging bucket rotor centrifuge and washed twice in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)).
units.rationale: Describes the initial steps to generate cortical organoids from iPS cells.

units.title: Nucleus isolation from fresh primary tissue
units.text: Cells (10^6) were pelleted and lysed for 3 min in 100 μl chilled lysis buffer (10 mM Tris‑HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween‑20, 0.1% Igepal CA‑630, 0.01% digitonin, 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA)). Lysed cells were then washed with 1 ml chilled wash buffer (10 mM Tris‑HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween‑20, 1% BSA) and nuclei were pelleted at 500g for 5 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Provides a concrete protocol for isolating nuclei from fresh tissue.

units.title: Single‑cell RNA‑seq library preparation (10X Genomics)
units.text: Single‑cell RNA‑seq libraries were generated using the 10X Genomics Chromium 3′ Gene Expression Kit. In brief, single cells were loaded onto chromium chips with a capture target of 10,000 cells per sample.
units.rationale: Outlines the core steps for preparing scRNA‑seq libraries with the 10X platform.

units.title: Bulk ATAC‑seq library preparation
units.text: Bulk ATAC‑seq libraries were generated as described57. In brief, 50,000 nuclei were permeabilized and tagmented. Tagmented chromatin libraries were generated and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target sequencing depth of 50 million reads per library.
units.rationale: Summarizes the procedure for bulk ATAC‑seq library creation.

units.title: H3K27ac CUT&Tag library preparation (modified)
units.text: H3K27ac CUT&Tag libraries were prepared as previously described60, with modifications. In brief, cells were dissociated from human cortical tissue as described above. Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer. Primary antibody (1:50 dilution) was added and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary shaker rotating at 90 rpm. Excess primary antibody was removed by pelleting the nuclei at 600g and washing twice in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer. Secondary antibody (1:50 dilution) was added at a dilution of 1:50 in 100 μl dig‑wash buffer and nuclei were incubated at room temperature for 30 min while rotating. Excess secondary antibody was removed by pelleting the nuclei at 600g and washing twice in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer. pA‑Tn5 was added at a dilution of 1:100 in 100 μl dig‑med buffer (0.05% digitonin, 20 mM HEPES, pH 7.5, 300 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail), and nuclei were incubated at room temperature for 1 h while rotating. Unbound pA‑Tn5 was removed by pelleting the nuclei at 300g and washing twice in 200 μl dig‑med buffer. Nuclei were resuspended in 100 μl tagmentation buffer (10 mM MgCl2 in dig‑med buffer) and incubated for 1 h at 37 °C. After tagmentation, nuclei were lysed with the addition of 100 μl DNA binding buffer (Zymo Research), and DNA was purified with a 1.5:1 ratio of AMPure XP beads.
units.rationale: Details the step‑by‑step CUT&Tag workflow for H3K27ac profiling.

units.title: Single‑cell ATAC‑seq library preparation (10X Genomics)
units.text: Single‑cell ATAC‑seq libraries were prepared for sequencing following the 10X Genomics single‑cell ATAC‑seq solution protocol (v1.0 kit was used). Nuclei were loaded with a capture target of 10,000 nuclei per sample. Libraries were prepared for sequencing following the 10X Genomics Cell Ranger ATAC pipeline.
units.rationale: Provides the essential actions for generating scATAC‑seq libraries using the 10X system.

units.title: Sequencing parameters for scRNA‑seq and scATAC‑seq libraries
units.text: scRNA‑seq libraries were sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a targeted sequencing depth of 50,000 reads per cell. scATAC‑seq libraries were sequenced using PE150 sequencing on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target depth of 25,000 reads per nucleus.
units.rationale: Specifies the sequencing depth and platform settings for the generated libraries.

units.title: Data processing for scRNA‑seq
units.text: BCL files from sequencing were then used as inputs to the 10X Genomics Cell Ranger pipeline.
units.rationale: Indicates the computational pipeline used to process raw scRNA‑seq data.

units.title: Data processing for scATAC‑seq
units.text: BCL files generated from sequencing were used as inputs to the 10X Genomics Cell Ranger ATAC pipeline. FASTQ files were generated and aligned to GRCh38 using BWA. Fragment files generated from the Cell Ranger ATAC pipeline were then loaded into the SnapATAC61 pipeline.
units.rationale: Describes the workflow for converting raw scATAC‑seq reads into analyzable fragment files.
